para.text: You might ask, considering that any view or presenter class can be used as an applet, why we have chosen to implement a special sample rather than just choosing to use the Hello World example that comes with the base Dolphin system. The reason is that the latter is implemented as a top-level window (it is subclassed from

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-style:italic; color:#000000;

para.text: ShellView

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: ) and we want to demonstrate an applet that is not normally a top-level view. Because of this you'll see that the example instance you've created does not have the normal top-level window furniture. Indeed, since there is no close box, the only way to close this example window is to evaluate:

text.style: font-family:'Courier New'; font-size:10pt; color:#000000;

para.text: hello close.
